p: Similarly, seven IRF7 isoforms were identified, and splicing patterns of the coding and noncoding transcripts are shown in Figure 9. Of these, five were novel AS forms and two were extant in the NCBI database ( Figure 9A). Out of the seven isoforms identified, four DIUs were as abundant as the wild-type IRF7 mRNA ( Figure 9B). PB.6624.20 and PB123733 isoforms encode COOH terminal truncations of IRF7 and lack the NH2 terminal IRF DNA-binding domain.
